casebody.data:
JERSEY CENTRAL POWER & LIGHT COMPANY, PLAINTIFF-RESPONDENT, v. THE TOWNSHIP COMMITTEE OF THE TOWNSHIP OF LAKEWOOD IN THE COUNTY OF OCEAN, A MUNICIPAL CORPORATION OF THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY, DEFENDANT-APPELLANT. Superior Court of New Jersey Appellate Division Argued May 4, 1981 Decided May 18, 1981.

Before Judges ALLCORN, PRESSLER and FURMAN.

*611John F. Briscoe argued the cause for appellant. Richard S. Cohen argued the cause for respondent. PER CURIAM.

The judgment of the Law Division is affirmed essentially for the reasons set forth in the opinion of Judge Serpentelli reported in 174 N.J.Super. 394 (Law Div.1980).

Affirmed.
